result.execSummary:
The defendant Veronica N Vernon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Veronica N Vernon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Veronica N Vernon was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Veronica N Vernon

records.addlTxt: CORRECTION TO 10/07/22 PLEA AND SENTENCING:  Defendant pled NO CONTEST to Count 2 and Count 1 was dismissed.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm

Defendant Veronica N Vernon in court.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre in court for Veronica N Vernon.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 17 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 17 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Submit a DNA sample by 10/14/22 and pay the surcharge by 4/07/23.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 4/07/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of her right to appeal.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-07-2022, filed.  rmm
Pretrial Services Violation Report 10.4.22, filed.  rmm
At the request of the defense, with no objection from the state, the 9/21/22 status conference is vacated and a plea and sentencing is scheduled for 10/07/22 at 3:30 pm.  rmm

Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre in court, defendant Veronica N Vernon not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Saint Pierre has received discovery and an offer and would like a status date to review with client.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with A. H.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Veronica N Vernon in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Veronica N Vernon in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Veronica N Vernon appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.   
This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
